page.title: 14Wildlife in Bicknoller
page.content: The{Quarry and Combe}behind it at Bicknoller is a fine place for the {amateur naturalist. } The habitat varies over a fairly short distance. There are the steep, bare walls of the Quarry, dense clumps of woodland and shrubs, a little bubbling stream with springs and boggy banks and rising from this the steep sides of the Combe clad with a rich variety of moorland vegetation. The most exciting animal that the visitor is likely to see is the{Red {Deer. }This fine mammal can quite often be seen grazing on the sides of the Combe. On the lower slopes of the hill and bordering the farmland a fox can sometimes be seen. On the other hand, the{Badger,}though known to be around is much more elusive.
